meanings.definition: A group of scientists who classify organisms based on shared characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The cladists studied the animals to see which ones had similar features.
meanings.sent2: Many cladists believe in grouping species by their common traits.
meanings.sent3: The cladists chuckled as they realized they were like detectives solving a biological puzzle.
meanings.sent4: In the world of biology, cladists are like architects, building family trees of living beings.
meanings.sent5: The image of cladists meticulously examining creatures under a microscope stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: Members of a school of thought in biology that emphasizes evolutionary relationships.
meanings.sent1: The cladists discussed how species are connected through evolution.
meanings.sent2: In the classroom, the teacher explained the importance of cladists in understanding evolution.
meanings.sent3: During the biology conference, the cladists shared jokes about how species are like distant cousins.
meanings.sent4: The concept of cladists as detectives uncovering the secrets of evolution fascinated me.
meanings.sent5: The idea of cladists as evolutionary storytellers made me appreciate the complexity of life even more.
